file_content.text: The mission was a failure. <<1>> was unsuccessful and has returned.
<<1>> successfully completed the assignment and has returned.

Sea Caves of Iskalon
Dropping sea levels on Iskalon have revealed long-hidden caves, once occupied centuries ago. Send your companion to investigate.
<<1>> braved the tides to discover a network of caves, which Iskalon's species used to hide from slavers. Several possessions had been washed into the back of the caves as well.
The Wroshyr Tree's Tale
One of the oldest wroshyr trees on Kashyyyk, millennia old, is finally dying. Its rings tell the story of Kashyyyk's history; have your companion examine them.
<<1>> studied the wroshyr tree's rings, able to track dozens of ecological events on Kashyyyk over the centuries.
A Sarlacc's Stomach

The enormous, worm-like Sarlacc takes centuries to digest its prey. On Duroon, a Sarlacc dead from disease has been pulled aboveground; send your companion to dredge its stomach for preserved antiquities.
<<1>> gamely took on the disgusting task of searching the Sarlacc's stomach contents, and found an intriguing artifact among the bones and goo.
Rejuvenation
The medically adept Selkath have revived the captain of a pre-hyperdrive vessel from suspended animation. Have your companion meet with the captain.
<<1>> and the captain--still confused from revivification--bonded over discussions of the captain's native era. The captain presented <<1>> with a gift from her ship.
The Syned Conjunction
Every six hundred years, the stars align and an alien obelisk on Syned One reveals strange inscriptions. The time is now; send your companion to observe.
<<1>> deciphered a map from the writings on the mysterious obelisk, which led to a strange discovery!
Memoirs of a Crimelord
Zirchros the Hutt, at the extreme age of 1,700 years, is dying. In his personal medical facility, he is telling stories of the early days of the Republic underworld; send your companion to listen.
<<1>> spent time with the ancient Hutt and learned the secret of his father's hoard--a collection of cultural artifacts from a long-dead people.
A Painted History
Miners on Kintan have discovered amazing cave paintings, possibly created by pre-civilization Nikto. Have your companion discover the cave paintings' story.
<<1>> studied the cave paintings. They describe four terrible wars in Kintan's ancient history, and honor a particular warlord named Da-Shek Yalaa.
Slaves of Begeren
In ancient times, the Imperial slaves of Begeren created great monuments to their masters. Send your companion to excavate the artistry left behind.
<<1>> has returned from Begeren, having studied the slaves' craft and analyzed the secret messages they recorded in the Sith statues... messages that led <<1>> to an amazing find!
The Aqueducts of Haffrin
The aqueducts of the planet Haffrin are a technological wonder, built by an unknown species millennia ago. Can your companion discover the secret of their origins?
<<1>> analyzed the aqueducts, their architecture and design, and concluded that they were built by early Ithorian explorers. This could lead to great debate in Ithorian culture.
The Detritus of History
The junkers of Orma have covered their planet in scrapyards of cultural artifacts--everything from toys to tech. Within the garbage are items of amazing value, if only your companion can find them.
<<1>> searched through the junk for what seemed like an eternity, but the time was worth it--you've obtained a relic from the height of the Tion Hegemony!
Battle of Terror
The Knell of Muspilli death cultists once battled the Warriors of Shadow above a nameless moon. Have your companion study the wreckage of this terrible battle.
<<1>> visited the terrible battle site in the Unknown Regions, and found an artifact of one of the cults buried deep in one of their derelict starships.
The Consortium
A consortium of alien merchants is offering "arcane and esoteric devices from ages primeval" at an auction. Send your companion to investigate.
<<1>> visited the merchants and earned entrance into the back rooms of the alien auction--where religious relics of long-dead cultures were for sale!
Corruption of the Baran Do
You've found evidence of a conspiracy to conceal a long-dead cult within the Baran Do Sages--the Force-using order of Kel Dor aliens. Have your companion seek information.

<<1>> found an ancient Baran Do monastery, where it became clear that a small faction of the alien Force users once sought to join the Sith! <<1>> found and retrieved the cultists' offerings to the long-dead Darth Sion.
The Memory Machines
A starship manned by droids devoted to recording galactic events has arrived from unknown space. Send your companion to trade information with them.
<<1>> made contact with the historian droids and their leader, NL0-A. The droid, impressed with the knowledge <<1>> had to offer, has provided access to its archives.
Pilgrimage
A small sect of Chevin makes a pilgrimage to a nameless blue sun every three years, as part of an ancient ritual. Have your companion follow and learn the sect's history.
<<1>> was welcomed by the Chevin sect and shown into its ancient stronghold at the end of the pilgrimage. The Chevin instructed <<1>> in the ways of their sacred idol and offered their aid.
A Forgotten Journey
An ancient frigate has recently emerged from the treacherous Kalki Nebula, adrift and unresponsive. Have your companion board the ship to discover its origin.
<<1>> boarded the ship, well-preserved by vacuum. It appears to be an ancient trading vessel; <<1>> was able to download its navigation logs and recover some of its preserved cargo.
Treasure Map
Inscribed in this object is a star map revealing clues to a supposed treasure. Have your companion follow the map into unknown space.
<<1>> deciphered the map's clues and traveled to a series of strange moons, before finally uncovering a whispering Rakata device!
Riddles of the Krath
These ancient scrolls appear to have been written by members of the old Krath cult, filled with strange riddles. Can your companion solve them?
After long research and many failed attempts, <<1>> finally solved the Krath riddles, discovering many of the cult's forgotten doctrines.
The Forgotten Prison
A survey team has discovered an ancient Sith oubliette on Dromund Fels. Send your companion to explore the catacombs and evade their traps.
In the Sith oubliette, <<1>> discovered the perfectly preserved body of an ancient prisoner in a room filled with lost treasures.
The Peacekeepers
Centuries ago, a faction split from the Jedi Order and devoted itself to contemplation and nonviolence. The Peacekeepers' deserted temple has been discovered; send your companion to investigate.
<<1>> explored the tranquil Peacekeeper temple and discovered a hidden chamber below the plaza fountains. The last, greatest writings of the Peacekeepers are in your hands.
Lost Sith Warship
A derelict Sith starship has been drifting through deep space since the Great Hyperspace War. Send your companion to unseal and investigate the ship.
<<1>> unsealed the lost Sith starship and discovered its cargo--lost artifacts from Korriban, saved from the Jedi invasion of the planet a thousand years ago!
Legacy of Master Mical
Jedi Master Mical was one of the order's greatest historians. He left an archive in the Cron Drift that was devastated during the war; send your companion to recover what remains.
<<1>> found Jedi Master Mical's archive. Inside, safely preserved from the Imperial attack, was Mical's holocron and his gift to the next generation of Jedi.
Leaving a Mark
Recent sensor mappings show the enormous Pentakus Crater on Taskeed was artificially created millennia ago. Have your companion find out how and why.
<<1>> discovered the Pentakus Crater was created by a long-ago weapons test. Fragments of the weapon suggest the test was ordered by the Tionese despot Xim.
The Broken Fleet
The moons of Denbalen are orbited by the shattered remains of an ancient, unidentified fleet. Have your companion brave Denbalen's harsh gravity to investigate.
<<1>> made a risky foray into the fleet debris. The ancient starships' origin is still a mystery, but <<1>> recovered several artifacts that might eventually shed some light.
Light in the Sky
The planet Seluket has many inexplicable stone monuments, centuries old. Recently, glowing patterns have appeared upon them; have your companion investigate this phenomenon.
<<1>> studied Seluket's monuments and realized the patterns warn of some impending ecological disaster. Seluket's inhabitants will be on their guard.
Caught in Crystal
Mygeeto is known for its beautiful crystal formations, but some of them appear to have been deliberately shaped long ago. Send your companion to examine them.
<<1>> determined that Mygeeto's crystal formations had been shaped by the Infinite Empire's slaves millennia ago, to commemorate a now long-forgotten victory.
Under Hosko's Fields
Farmers plowing on Hosko have uncovered buried weapons and droids, discarded on a forgotten battlefield. Send your companion to discover more about this battle.
<<1>> determined that the battlefield is from the Hutt Cataclysms, fought within the young Hutt Empire, and salvaged one of the droids.
The Palace of the Kumauri
A crumbling palace built by the ancient Kumauri Empire has been found on an Outer Rim moon. Send your companion to learn more about this almost-forgotten civilization.
<<1>> explored the palace and found a fresco depicting a long-forgotten battle between the Kumauri Empire and the Republic, including an image of the conqueror Vall Kumauri's flagship.
Entralla's Inscriptions
Entralla is home to dozens of religions, coexisting in harmony. The inscriptions on this statuette suggest they may have a common origin; have your companion journey to Entralla to study more.
<<1>>'s visit to Entralla was enlightening, suggesting Entralla's various religions are older than anyone thought.
A Crypt of Blades
The Yovshin Swordsmen are legendary, as are their Jar'Kai blades. When one dies, his sword is retired to a secret crypt; see if your companion can trace this stolen weapon to its original tomb.
<<1>> traced the stolen weapon back to a crypt filled with hundreds of Jar'Kai blades, each reverently stored with a datapad describing its owner's achievements.
Legacy of Dathka Graush
The ancient Sith Lord Dathka Graush once dwelled in the Naos Asteroid Belt. Your companion will search the asteroids for anything that survived over the centuries.
<<1>> found the millennia-old fortress of Dathka Graush in the Naos Asteroid Belt, and opened its lost vaults.
Race to the Prize
Well-funded archaeologists are searching for an alien artifact in the Veragi Sector. Send your companion to trail them and beat them to their find.
<<1>> pursued the Imperial archaeologists and found what they were after--an abandoned Gree outpost! <<1>> managed to restore the outpost to life, defeating the Imperials with its defenses.
Follow the Trail
Research vessels are scouting planets in the Lifh Sector. Your companion will trail the researchers and attempt to beat them to any finds.

Staying one step ahead of the Republic surveyors, <<1>> discovered a long-lost human colony founded before the days of lightspeed exploration. The colony's cultural lore is now yours, and <<1>> has hidden it from the Republic.
Lost World's Return
A newly discovered hyperspace route leads to Bezha Two, a founding member of the Republic thought lost in a supernova. Send your companion to make contact.
<<1>> traveled to the lost planet and found that the peoples of Bezha Two remember the early Republic well. During their celebrations, they offered their full support to you and <<1>>.
Embraced by the Ice
Raxus Two is a frozen world, but recent studies suggest it was once inhabited by the ancient Tionese Empire. Have your companion investigate for relics.
<<1>> discovered the remnants of a Tionese staging post, abandoned millennia ago before Raxus entered an ice age, and recovered the staging post's logs.
Jawa Antiquities
The Hutts have hired Jawas to dig for artifacts on Dennogra, but the Jawas might be interested in secretly selling their finds. Send your companion.
<<1>> haggled with the Jawas for hours, but eventually got several interesting trinkets for a good price.
Filthy Business
Attahox is a garbage planet, used for centuries by criminal gangs as a hideout and cache. Have your companion see what secrets lie buried in refuse.
<<1>> came back stinking of garbage, but also recovered evidence of a long-forgotten criminal cartel called the Broken Spine.
Fall of the Catacombs
Exchange mining teams are digging perilously close to the famed Shola Catacombs. Send your companion to survey the catacombs before they collapse!
<<1>> risked everything to explore the catacombs, recovering a relic from its central chamber before rubble began to fall from the ceilings.
Glorzo's Gifts
Glorzo the Hutt boasts of owning the largest assortment of Rakata artifacts in the galaxy. Send your companion to examine Glorzo's collection.
It seems Glorzo's artifacts are mostly clever fakes, but <<1>> spotted a real Rakata device amongst them and was able to study it carefully.
Under the Glass Desert
During the bombardment of the planet Serroco centuries ago, many of its Stereb civilians hid in underground shelters. Send your companion to study the remaining shelters.
<<1>> discovered an intact Stereb shelter, accidentally sealed and locked after the Battle of Serroco. It contained many forgotten Stereb artifacts.
Bank on Us
The Bank of Aargu is emptying out all safety deposit boxes unclaimed for more than four hundred years. Have your companion see what treasures were stored there.
Posing as an assessor, <<1>> joined the bank staff as they opened the largest deposit box, which held royal Onderon heirlooms hidden for safekeeping during the Naddist Uprising.
Calling Home
This datapad contains a distress call written in a Duros dialect older than the Republic itself. Its origin is in the Elrood Sector. Send your companion to seek out its source.
<<1>> found one of the earliest Duros scouting vessels, crashed on Akana. Its memory banks describe the first hyperspace explorations!
The Hebine Ring
The designs in this relic suggest the Hebine Ring, an asteroid belt in the Beheboth system, was a place of importance to the ancient Sith. Send your companion to find out why.
<<1>> found the remains of a Sith observatory on a large asteroid and discovered a surviving cache of ancient star charts!
Savagery of the Taung
Rumors are spreading that the Taung--the lost species that gave birth to the Mandalorians--are alive on Gargon Two. Your companion can investigate.
In the jungles of Gargon Two, <<1>> found a primitive warrior society--not Taung, but aliens trained by them long ago. <<1>> gained their respect and received a gift from the savage creatures.
Sailing into Fate
A wooden sailing ship has been dredged from the waters of Ord Cantrell. Have your companion examine it to learn who sailed the planet so long ago.
The ancient sailing ship appears to be from a Duros colony that lost contact with the galaxy and returned to simple technology. <<1>> brought back the inscriptions secreted in the ship's hull.
Zygerrian Underground
Orbital bombing over Zygerria Four has revealed the ruins of an underground alien city. Your companion will explore the city and search for intact artifacts.
<<1>> narrowly escaped the destruction of the underground Zygerrian city by a misplaced orbital strike--but also recovered an alien relic from the city's central palace.
Wake the Leviathan
A shady scrap dealer is selling a broken-down vessel which he claims is the Leviathan, once Darth Malak's flagship. Send your companion to determine if it is authentic.
<<1>> confirmed the starship wasn't the Leviathan, but it was an authentic ship from the same period. <<1>> was able to get a mission log describing long-ago battles.
The Storyteller
The Draethos wanderer Rido-Attar has been walking the galaxy for over six hundred years. He has recently returned to the Core Worlds; send your companion to learn from his tales.
<<1>> spoke with Rido-Attar on Alsakan. He shared the secrets he'd learned about the heroes of the Jedi Civil War, and gave <<1>> a parting gift.
Anomid Symposium
Anomid technicians have discovered blueprints for an ancient Columi machine, and are attempting to recreate it with modern materials. Send your companion to observe.
The Anomid technicians successfully created a working version of the Columi machine! The Anomids were so pleased, they allowed <<1>> full access to their research notes.
The Gangster's Graveyard
Makem Te is rumored to hide many skeletons--former enemies of the crime lord Gester Noxx who were marooned in the planet's deserts centuries ago. Have your companion seek them out.
After searching the desert, <<1>> found the body of Zalin Lih, Gester Noxx's greatest adversary, and a holojournal detailing his last days on the planet.
Far From Home
The data you uncovered contains garbled messages intercepted by a listening post, encoded with an Imperial cipher not used for hundreds of years. Have your companion investigate.
<<1>> traced the signal and discovered a crashed ship, once part of the Empire's fleet during the flight from Korriban, which had been lost during the journey.
Fire-Lords of Sullust
On the conquered world of Sullust, an expedition has discovered a Sullustan shrine buried by volcanic dust. Have your companion join the expedition and study the ancient Sullustans' gods.
<<1>> discovered a machine in the Sullustan shrine designed to "speak" to the planet's volcanoes. Its key pieces are now in your hands.
The Moff's Spoils
Explorer Trissa Janthir has returned from visiting primitive planets in the Outer Rim, artifacts in hand. Send your companion to consult with her and study what she's acquired.
Moff Janthir welcomed <<1>> and offered a tour of the treasures he pillaged. <<1>> identified an alien Kwa artifact among the primitive trinkets, and the Moff has asked you to study it for him.
Hidden Sins
The ruins of an early Bith prison colony have been discovered on Clak'dor Five. The Bith are refusing to let anyone explore, but your companion could learn much, at great risk.

<<1>> slipped past Bith security to explore the penal colony, finding relics and evidence of religious persecution in the early days of Bith spaceflight. No wonder the Bith authorities prefer to keep this private.
The Gorm Academy
An ancient academy on Gorm had many secrets hidden by its architect. Its caretakers might allow your companion to study it in return for a donation.
<<1>> worked with the Telos Academy's caretakers and found one of the academy's many dark secrets--a Jedi weapon created by Atris, the academy's tragic founder.
Monuments to Dust
The worlds of the Lenico system have enormous, mysterious monuments carved from the native stone. Have your companion examine them.
On Lenico Four, <<1>> found the remains of a camp once used by the builders of these mysterious monuments and recovered several artifacts.
Relics of the Kwa
Strange ruins, possibly built by the ancient Kwa, have been found in the Yhuli system. Send your companion to explore and bring back any finds.
<<1>> found the ruins were once a Star Temple, built to safeguard the Kwa's mysterious technology.
A Silent City
An old settlement has been found on the volcanic moon Kalakar Six, preserved by ash after an eruption. Have your companion explore the ruins to discover its secrets.
The settlement was a mining colony from the early days of the Empire, perfectly preserved. <<1>> even found the holojournal of the colony's governor.
Washed
The canals of Abregado-rae's capital have been temporarily drained. The detritus of the canals tells the story of the city's history; send your companion to sort through it.
<<1>> found several items in the Abregado-rae canals but also studied their construction, seeing how each ruler of the capital has added to them over the years.
The Endex Daredevils
Many pilots have trained in the canyons of Endex over the centuries. Some of them leave wreckage behind; have your companion study these derelicts.
<<1>> trekked Endex's canyons, recovering a starship once owned by the ace Duros pilot Welex Korofu.
Shattered Armor
The fragment of Mandalorian armor you discovered is centuries old, marked with symbols of the Battle of Althir. Have your companion trace it back to its origin.
<<1>> traced the armor fragment back to an ancient Mandalorian warlord and found records of his conquests and his treasures!
House Mecetti's Losses
The noble House Mecetti is sponsoring expeditions to recover heirlooms lost during the Great Sith War. Send your companion to find them--and gain House Mecetti's favor.
<<1>> explored the Tapani Sector and tracked down several lost Mecetti artworks and ancestral weapons. House Mecetti has offered one of the heirlooms as a reward.
A Long Path Home
During its decades-long voyage from Korriban to Dromund Kaas, the Empire left navigational beacons on a number of worlds. Send your companion to recover these important artifacts.
<<1>> recovered a beacon left by the Imperial fleet's flagship, containing a full manifest of the fleet and a log of the Imperials' journey.
The Tetan Mosaic
It is said that a mosaic in the Tetan royal palace conceals an encoded secret. Have your companion discover if there's any truth to this.
<<1>> realized the mosaic described the location of a secret chamber once owned by Memit Nadill, a Jedi advisor to Empress Teta. The chamber still hid many of Nadill's possessions.
Secrets of the Bendu
Several Bendu monks have been traveling the Core Worlds, escorting a mysterious casket. This is a unique opportunity to study a Bendu artifact--send your companion.
<<1>> politely approached the Bendu monks. They claimed the casket contains a meditating Bendu master, and explained the pictograms written on it.
Black Market Medicine
Rumors suggest valuable organic compounds are being sold in the black market city of Depatar. Send your companion to investigate.
<<1>> obtained a number of extremely rare and valuable items while visiting the black markets of Depatar.
Forgotten Knowledge
The ruins of several abandoned research stations have been discovered in the jungles of Dxun. Send your companion to explore the labs.
Battling Dxun's fierce predators, <<1>> discovered the remnants of an incredible experiment inside one of the abandoned labs on the planet's surface.
Mad Droid's Lab
One of the laboratories of XN-D1, a droid obsessed with dissecting biological life, has been found. Have your companion raid it for valuable data.
<<1>> penetrated the droid's lab and found its owner luckily absent. His experiments, however, are now in your hands.
Stolen Medical Supplies
The Exchange crime syndicate has captured a medical frigate carrying strictly regulated biohazardous materials. Have your companion track down the goods.
<<1>> tracked the stolen medical supplies to a black market merchant on Cato Neimoidia. For a small price, they are now yours.
Tirsan Spice
The wildlife of Tirsa has evolved to rely on the planet's local spice deposits. Have your companion examine the creatures' unique biology.
<<1>> visited Tirsa and took blood samples from the local animals. The spice seems to have bonded to their blood cells; if duplicated in other creatures, this could lead to fantastic results.
The Belly of the Worm
The lair of a rare exogorth, an enormous space-dwelling worm, has been found in the Minos Cluster. Have your companion venture in to study it.
<<1>> reached the exogorth's lair, just as the huge worm was shedding its skin! <<1>> managed to retrieve several pieces of the valuable skin before retreating.
Held in Amber
Large deposits of fossilized amber have been found on Phoebus, containing many preserved plant and insect specimens. Send your companion to examine them.
<<1>> found several interesting specimens in the amber and brought them back for study.
Boma Breeding
One Mandalorian clan has bred the vicious animals called bomas for centuries. Have your companion visit the breeding pens and study boma physiology.
<<1>> studied the bomas and received several generations of genetic data from their Mandalorian breeders.
Higher Education
The medlab at the University of Charmath possesses some of the galaxy's most extensive medical records. Send your companion to study alongside the researchers.
<<1>> visited the university and consulted with one of the galaxy's foremost authorities on biological research, who gladly provided his aid.
Flora of the Outer Rim
An automated probe vessel sent to catalog the flora of uninhabited Outer Rim worlds has turned up in the Shandola Sector. Send your companion to investigate.
While searching the derelict probe vessel, <<1>> discovered several valuable flora samples gathered from previously unexplored worlds.
Signs of Life
A routine scan of Gelemeade's fourth moon discovered signs that simple organic life may thrive below the uninhabitable surface. Send your companion to investigate.
Deep beneath the surface of an otherwise lifeless moon, <<1>> located a thriving oasis of exotic organic life. The unique samples <<1>> collected should prove very valuable.
Under the Sea
The Selkath are launching an expedition to explore the ocean floor of Manaan. Send your companion to see if viable samples can be recovered.
<<1>> has returned from the depths of Manaan's oceans with a variety of biological samples.
Twisted Evolution
Surveys have detected unusual mutations in the flora on the polluted surface of Exigar. Send your companion to investigate.
Pollution on Exigar has caused abnormal variations in native life. <<1>> was able to recover several interesting specimens from the surface.
The Mines of Doan
Mining operations on Doan report massive underground chambers teeming with subterranean life. Send your companion to investigate.
In the underground caverns of Doan, <<1>> harvested rare subterranean lichens and fungi with remarkable properties.
The Forests of Kashyyyk
Remote surveys deep in the heart of Kashyyyk's primeval forests have reported unusual biological findings. Send your companion to learn more.
Venturing deep into the heart of Kashyyyk's primeval forest, <<1>> discovered rare specimens with incredible biological properties.
Renegade Scientist
A shuttle carrying the eccentric but brilliant bioanalyst Doctor Ronda crashed on Corsin. Send your companion to investigate.
Doctor Ronda did not survive the shuttle crash, but in the wreckage, <<1>> discovered amazing specimens from his latest research.
The Lost Gardens of Useria
The datapad you found contains scans of the ruins of the legendary Lunar Gardens on the moon of Useria. Send your companion to see if any rare samples still survive.
During the excavation of the Lunar Gardens, <<1>> discovered a hidden cache of rare and valuable specimens.
The Butcher's Lab
Your intercepted transmission describes a laboratory once owned by the notorious Mandalorian "surgeon" Demagol. The Senate has ordered the lab destroyed; have your companion search it first.
Though Demagol's lab was horribly disturbing, <<1>> managed to save his various research notes from the Republic demolitionists. Some use may come of them yet.
A Millennium Apart
During the Empire's exile from the larger galaxy, its species developed in isolation. Have your companion compare Imperial biosamples to those from other worlds.
<<1>> compared genetic scans from plants, animals and people isolated on Imperial worlds to those from similar creatures elsewhere. The variance is subtle, but real--and has lead to a breakthrough!
Creeping Toxins
A dormant bioweapon has activated on Aaeton, causing the rapid spread of toxic molds through nearby settlements. Send your companion to lend aid.
<<1>> studied the spread of the deadly mold and located the Imperial device that initiated the infestation. The colony's troubles should end shortly.
The Terror Plague
A terrible disease inducing fever and hallucinations is spreading on Ord Dorlass. Have your companion penetrate the quarantine and take samples from the victims.
<<1>> avoided dangerous exposure to the disease on Ord Dorlass while obtaining the desired samples.
Steel Fertilizer
The plant life of the industrial world Mechis Two has adapted to grow inside droids and other machines. Have your companion study this phenomenon.
<<1>> dissected several nonfunctional droids on Mechis Two to sample the plant life growing inside.
Urban Degeneration
Shambling, semi-human man-eaters--Cthons, rakghouls, vrblthers--have evolved in parallel on several city planets. Have your companion study these dangerous beings.
<<1>> obtained genetic samples from the urban monstrosities, seeking similarities in their makeup. The results are inconclusive, but humanoid predators seem drawn to the lowest levels of city-worlds.
Time Capsule
A biological "time capsule" created by an unknown species to contain genetic samples twenty millennia ago has been discovered. Have your companion retrieve it.
<<1>> gained access to the ancient alien time capsule and the genetic data contained inside. In addition, <<1>> managed to unlock a secret compartment in the capsule!
Biogenesis
Microbial life has been found on a moon of Kiskua--a previously lifeless world! Have your companion study the delicate process of biogenesis in the moon's stormy seas.
<<1>> observed the formation of microbial life on the Kiskuan moon and cautiously obtained a sample, along with scans of the planet's base materials.
The Hutt's Kitchen
Ooroz the Hutt eats only animals and plants specially engineered by his scientists. Have your companion purchase a tour of the Hutt's laboratories.
<<1>> received permission to explore the Hutt's tasting laboratories and purchased samples of the scientists' genetic data.
A Legacy of Healing
A corporate espionage report suggests the elderly Doctor Fylan was creating revolutionary medpacs, but died before trials were complete. See if your companion can finish his work.
<<1>> puzzled through Doctor Fylan's rambling notes and managed to create a powerful new formula! The doctor's legacy will survive after all.
The Mecrosa Assassins

The assassins of the fragmented Mecrosa Order are trained to survive toxic atmospheres, sickness and any poison in the galaxy. You found a contract that could lead to them--and their biological secrets.

By secretly accessing the Mecrosa Order's files, <<1>> learned that their assassins take a strange chemical cocktail to immunize themselves. The information and genetic samples will be enormously valuable.
Exit Interview
The Anomid bioweapons designer Voklov Adaim is being executed for crimes against his people. Send your companion to consult with him before his demise.
<<1>> obtained access to the imprisoned Anomid, who agreed to share his research and his materials in the name of science--despite his disdain for the Empire.
The Healing Moon
Loposi Three's moon has an artificial atmosphere comprised of nutrient-rich gasses derived from liquid kolto. Have your companion study the atmosphere's effects.
<<1>> traveled to the transformed moon and studied the effects of the healing gasses on bacteria colonies. The experiments resulted in some remarkable mutations!
The Genesis Pool
The ancient Sith Lord Dreypa mastered the art of creating life and left behind his "genesis pool"--a vat of strange organic substances--on Syngia. Have your companion visit.
<<1>> found the Sith genesis pool in the ruins of a strange temple and quickly obtained a vial of its contents before departing.
Remembering the Lost
The Tzorbi species was among the first to join the Republic but went extinct millennia ago. Have your companion visit the Tzorbi homeworld and study the fossils.
<<1>> journeyed to the Tzorbi homeworld and collected genetic traces of the long-dead aliens. In addition, <<1>> located an ancient Tzorbi medical lab!
Legacy of Malachor
Surveys of the asteroid field that was once the planet of Malachor Five indicate small pockets of biological life still active. Send your companion to investigate.
Scattered among the asteroid field that was once Malachor Five, <<1>> found a number of remarkable specimens.
Night Eternal
Giddea's sun is dying. Send your companion to the doomed world to harvest biological samples before the planet is shrouded in perpetual darkness.
<<1>> was able to harvest several rare and unusual specimens from Giddea's surface before its sun went forever dark.
Throwing it all Away
Doctor Menoda, the famous bioanalyst, has vowed to destroy his life's work to protest the Imperial-Republic conflict. Send your companion to salvage something of value from his lab.
<<1>> convinced Doctor Menoda to hand over his most valuable research before destroying his lab.
Poison Planet
A survey team on Ambria, a grim world poisoned by the dark side, discovered unusual signs of life near Lake Natth. Send your companion to investigate.
On the dying world of Ambria, <<1>> harvested rare and resilient specimens that managed to survive on the inhospitable shores of Lake Natth.
The Lost Laboratory
A functioning biodome from the Great Hyperspace War has been discovered. Several biological experiments are still running: have your companion examine them.
While <<1>> was exploring the biodome, one of the centuries-long experiments completed itself, yielding a valuable biosample.
Survival of the Strangest
Peculiar new plants and animals have suddenly appeared on the planet Denab. Send your companion to investigate and collect samples.
<<1>> discovered that Denab's new wildlife had been created by an ancient, malfunctioning Rakata device. Both the wildlife and the device yielded interesting samples.
Panathan Spring
You obtained a Panathan flower that has been presumed extinct for centuries. Send your companion to Panatha to study the apparently rejuvenated plant life.
<<1>> found a blooming jungle on Panatha filled with species emerging from near-extinction. The biological data you've acquired could open new insights.
Tainted Research
You obtained reports showing that an orbital bioresearch facility malfunctioned and crashed on Phaseera's surface. Send your companion to salvage specimens from the wreckage.
The bioresearch facility that crashed on Phaseera was destroyed, but <<1>> salvaged an incredibly rare implant from the wreckage.
Dying Breed
All life forms on Bhargebba Six are rapidly dying out. Have your companion obtain final samples before they are lost forever.
With the generous approval of Lord Tibris, <<1>> obtained valuable biological samples from Bhargebba Six before the extermination was carried out.
Starship Ecology
The massive explorer starship Dreams of Soil contains an artificial ecosystem complete with plants, animals and human pilots. Send your companion to study the ship.
<<1>> visited the massive starship and toured its onboard forests and lakes, befriending its inhabitants and obtaining the secrets of its creation!
Song of Csilla
Csilla, the Chiss homeworld, is off-limits to outsiders, but Chiss biologists are attempting to transplant Csillan flora to an ice world. Have your companion assist.
<<1>> worked alongside the Chiss and Imperial researchers. The Csillan plants initially refused to take root in foreign snow and soil, but <<1>> modified the environment for total success!
Reopening Old Wounds
Some veterans of the Great Galactic War now show signs of a neuromuscular disorder. Send your companion to examine and assist where possible.

<<1>> compared bioscans of numerous veterans, and made headway toward determining the source of the disorder--exposure to toxic smoke during the Sacking of Coruscant. This may be the first step toward a cure, and the grateful families of the veterans have pledged their support.
Hold Your Breath
The biologist Ajoha Jeh is developing special implants that will enable better exploration of toxic worlds. Send your companion to assist her work.
<<1>> tested Ajoha Jeh's new implants on the toxic planet of Goroth Prime. The test was a remarkable success--Ajoha has allowed <<1>> to keep her prototypes as payment.
The Nightlands
The "Nightlands" of the Twi'lek homeworld Ryloth are home to glowing crystalline plants and predatory beasts. Have your companion join an expedition to explore them.
<<1>> claimed many samples from Ryloth's crystalline trees, and learned plenty from the equipment used to survey in complete darkness.
A Forest of Poison
Cadannia's jungle flora produces some of the most potent toxins in the galaxy. Have your companion study these plants and their poisons.
While gathering toxin extracts from Cadannia, <<1>> discovered the jungles are much older than originally thought, which might account for the variety of poisonous plants.
Hunting the Zakkeg
A Mandalorian clan wears distinctive armor made from the hide of the zakkeg beast. Have your companion accompany the clan on its next zakkeg hunt to study the rare creature.
<<1>> was present when the Mandalorians caught a huge zakkeg, not only gaining material from its body, but learning how the Mandalorians constructed their armor.
Spore Clouds
Huge clouds of spores have been sighted in the atmosphere of Chad Three. Send your companion to gather samples and discover their origin.
<<1>> took samples of the spores and discovered they were produced by a Sarlacc. One of these massive creatures must dwell somewhere on Chad Three.
Master of None
You found a reconnaissance scan of the Trandoshan warlord Tsheyk's game reserve on Vendaxa, full of the galaxy's most vicious beasts. Have your companion study these predators.
<<1>> discovered that the predators of Tsheyk's game reserve are forming a unique ecosystem of their own, and brought material back for study.
The Bloodflowers
A legendary flower blooms once a century on Grella. Since the Great Hyperspace War, almost no one has seen this happen; send your companion for the event.
<<1>> has returned with scans and samples of the legendary bloodflower of Korriban. In addition, you've discovered the bizarre insects that nest in its stem!
Shipborne Parasite
An exploration vessel has returned from the Unknown Regions with a purple slick over its hull. The substance seems organic; send your companion to study it.
<<1>> has taken samples of the strange substance clinging to the ship and identified it as the secretions of a spaceborne creature similar to a mynock.
In Its Bones
The preserved remains of an ancient sea monster have been discovered on Dac. Send your companion to take samples before the body decays.
<<1>> was able to recover over a dozen valuable samples from the sea monster before the body decayed too far.
Muunilinst's Mysteries
The metal-rich volcanic vents on Muunilinst feed a unique mini-ecosystem of plants and tubeworms. Send your companion to study the vents.
<<1>> discovered that the Muunilinst ferns growing on the volcanic vents are surprisingly hardy, and took several samples for later study.
Accidents Happen
A coolant refinery has exploded on Kuat, causing a huge chemical leak. Send your companion to study the effects on the refinery workers and Kuat's forests.
<<1>> discovered that the wildlife around the refinery is actually thriving on the combination of spilled chemicals, and took several specimens for study.
The Reefs of Sembla
The planet Sembla is home to enormous coral reefs, some of them undisturbed for centuries. Have your companion take a submersible down to study them.
<<1>> spent several pleasant hours exploring the reefs and encountered an entirely new species of Semblan eel hiding there.
Star Dwellers
A nameless asteroid field in the Deep Core hosts enormous life forms capable of surviving the vacuum of space. Have your companion attempt an examination.
<<1>> saw a variety of fantastic and dangerous creatures in the asteroid field, including an enormous slug-like creature. The scans <<1>> obtained are extremely detailed.
Strange Probe
A probe from an unknown species has arrived from deep space--apparently a bioengineered organism. Your companion can join the researchers studying it.
The bioengineered probe is a bizarre piece of technology, but <<1>> successfully extracted several fascinating samples and mapped out part of its creation process.
Hyperdrive Nests
A strange variety of beetle, adapted to feed on hyperdrive radiation, is infesting the Loronar shipyards. Send your companion to capture some of these bizarre creatures.
<<1>> captured several of the odd beetles infesting the shipyards, along with a massive queen beetle. Examining their biology should give insights into how they've grown to feed off energy.
Under a Red Star

The vial you found contains a mutated tissue sample from the planet Ch'hodos. It appears radiation from Ch'hodos's red sun has increased, affecting the planet's desert wildlife. Have your companion observe.
<<1>> found skeletal evidence of mutated creatures inside a cave, suggesting Ch'hodos's red sun has gone through this cycle before. The planet provided plenty of comparative samples.
The Dianoga Expedition
Professor Skatheris is studying dianoga in their native habitat on Vodran, hoping to eventually exterminate the pests elsewhere in the galaxy. Have your companion assist him.
Working alongside Lord Skatheris, <<1>> helped to develop a prototype anti-k'lor'slug serum. Skatheris rewarded <<1>> handsomely for the help.
Mensor's Work
Biologist Jav Mensor has collected many biological curiosities over the years. Have your companion request permission to tour his laboratories.
Pleased to meet a fellow enthusiast, Lord Mnesus allowed <<1>> to take samples from the rarest specimens in his laboratory.
Gene Chaos
The Kitonak citizens of the Bengely Four colony are undergoing a rapid series of benign genetic mutations. Have your companion study this phenomenon.
<<1>> visited the Kitonaks and attempted to isolate the cause of their mutations. The cause appears to be viral, augmented by a rare chemical in the colony's air supply.
Ithorian Expertise
Ithorian scientists are renowned for their expertise with plant life. Have your companion study with their best.
<<1>> was welcomed by the Agricultural Corps, whose members shared the secrets of their work and the various biological compounds they have developed.
The Bounty of Raxus Prime
For more than twenty thousand years, Raxus Prime has been the junkyard of countless civilizations. Send your companion to brave the toxic world in search of ancient technology.
A monumental scrapslide nearly buried <<1>> under centuries worth of junk, but the narrow escape revealed an ancient starship of unknown origin.
A Lonely Beacon
The emergency beacon of a friendly vessel winks on your sensor array. Send your companion to investigate the signal.
The beacon had served as a pirate lure to ensnare passing vessels until their last ambush caught something they couldn't handle, and the dead pirate fleet provided ample bounty.
Swap Meet
Nomads and vagabonds have peculiar tastes and needs and have little room to be picky. The savvy scavenger knows how to turn garbage to gold with little careful bartering.
After a down day of trading with various junk collectors, <<1>>'s luck turned full circle after a chance meeting with a stranded tourist in desperate need of spare parts.
Shaky Ground
Near-constant groundquakes on Riflor cause the borders of cities to ebb and flow like waves, leaving no shortage of resources buried in rubble. Send a companion to search the ruins.
<<1>> uncovered an Advozse shipyard preserved in a pocket under volcanic ash; with a little cleaning, the materials are good as new.
One Being's Garbage
You've caught wind of a sizable junkyard in the sector. Send your companion to pick through the scrap.
In a rare stroke of luck, <<1>> discovered a hidden smuggler's stash still inside one of the components taken from the scrapyard.
Jungle Medicine
Thyferra's reputation for miraculous botanical cures has blossomed over the last few decades, and resourceful botanists have made a killing as a result. Send a companion to harvest valuable plants.
Able to persuade one of the native Vratix to act as a guide, <<1>> is able to find all manner of rare and easily overlooked plants and fungi during the expedition.
The Junk Armada
The fabled "Junk Armada" is passing through this sector; hundreds of decommissioned ships yoked by magnetic fields. Send your companion to scour these derelicts for useful items.
The Junk Armada's eccentric "admiral" took a liking to <<1>>, and opened up some of the more intact vessels. <<1>> got a massive haul of scrap.
In the Wake
The bombardment of Zygerria Four continues to drive the violent slavers who've settled there out of their strongholds. Send your companion to search for their abandoned valuables.
The bombed-out palace of a rich slave trader provided <<1>> with a wealth of expensive goods.
Rust and Riches
The tourist liner Prince of Waves sunk on its centennial voyage around the ocean world of Manaan, and the ship remains an untouched prize of the deep. Send your companion to search for the wreck.
<<1>> found the Prince of Waves precariously balanced on the brink of one of Manaan's unfathomable trenches and was able to recover the riches of its passengers and crew.
Burial in the Void
After discovering a doomed escape pod left adrift long ago, you glean its origin. A derelict cruiser likely untouched, and unclaimed, for ages. Send your companion to stake a claim.
Despite catastrophic damage to much of the ship, the cruiser's armory, vaults and maintenance hangars were left entirely intact.
Lost Cargo
Underworld scuttlebutt about a free trader ditching his shipment of pricey goods during a heated pursuit has come to your attention. Send your companion to search for the abandoned cargo.
<<1>> discovered several of the ditched cargo containers orbiting a nearby moon and easily recovered them.
Crime Doesn't Pay
The so-called "Regretter's Rock" is a habitable asteroid where unlucky spacers have been habitually marooned over centuries. Send your companion to see what else has been left behind.
<<1>> stumbled across a survivor marooned on Regretter's Rock, and the haggard pirate agreed to lead <<1>> to his hidden treasure for a lift off the asteroid.
Combing the Sands
In the grim desolation of Sevarcos Two, the loss of even the most prosperous spice lords' tribes are all too common. Send a companion to uncover their lost wealth.
By pure chance, <<1>> discovered a half-buried spice lord's palace, and though its glory has long past, its wealth hasn't.
The Last Place You Look
You've discovered a nearby rescue signal from a treasure hunter requesting aid; attempts to make contact remotely are unsuccessful. Send a companion to investigate.
<<1>> found the luckless treasure hunter long dead, and while clearing his camp, <<1>> uncovered a hidden vault right under his feet.
Unsecure Load
Major spaceports are a whirlwind of activity where just about anything can be swept up and hurled off in the bustle. Send a companion to see what's slipped through the cracks.
Eyeing a crate that appeared to have been mistakenly loaded onto a palate of power cells, <<1>> discovered it was formerly a research shipment bound for Czerka Corellia.
People Throw Away the Darndest Things
Just because anything can be found on Nar Shaddaa for the right price, doesn't mean there isn't plenty for free. Send a companion to exploit the wastefulness there.
<<1>> chanced across the dock of a pleasure barge belonging to a particularly indulgent Hutt whose "garbage" would be anything but to anyone else.
Tell Me Everything
The famed Rodian salvager Pineek has been arrested. You found a secret message offering information on his best scavenging grounds to anyone who helps him out; have your companion arrange it.
With <<1>> arranging his freedom, Pineek handed over not only information on his scavenging grounds, but the valuable find he was arrested for carrying.
The Mighty Demolished
You decoded a message stating that the Empire is planning a secret demolitions test using a derelict dreadnaught. Send your companion to be the first salvager on the scene.
<<1>> waited until the Imperial demolitions crew left before securing the grand prize: the dreadnaught's still-intact engine core.
Raiding the Telos Restoration
The multi-century spanning restoration of Telos Four is, perhaps, the galaxy's most ambitious construction projects. Send your companion to find "misplaced" resources from the restoration.
<<1>> located and pilfered a pristine stash of rare materials bound for a monument in honor of those responsible for the Telos restoration's success.
Waste Not, Want Not
The barbarous gladiatorial games held all over Geonosis generate massive carnal mounds of slaughtered beasts and blasted equipment. Send your companion to save items of interest.
Among the piles of ferocious beasts, <<1>> finds a rare specimen whose parts are all too valuable for manufacturing.
The Rogue Moon
The formidable Death's Claw pirate fleet once made a stronghold of Taris's asteroid-battered "Rogue moon." Send your companion to brave rock storms that stand vigil over its wreckage.
<<1>> discovered a pirate captain's secret stash while looting the abandoned Death's Claw base.
Fleeced
A transport filled with Ayelixe Fabrico textiles exploded in the atmosphere over Rhinnal, scattering its cargo for kilometers. Send a companion to recover whatever possible.
<<1>> recovered a miraculously undamaged crate that crashed into a shallow pond after the blast.
Tortured Metal
The Maw Cluster around Kessel has been a graveyard for countless ships, slowly being pulled apart by fluctuating gravity fields. Your companion could brave the dangers and search for salvage.
Despite being twisted by a violent gravitational tug-of-war, the hulk of a mysterious dreadnaught provides <<1>> with a treasure trove of salvage.
Outsourcing
Since the accidental introduction of womp rats on Yev, the colonists have been plagued by their rapid reproduction and hoarding tendencies. Send your companion to search for collected treasures.
By following a pack of womp rats back to their nest, <<1>> discovered the creatures making their home in a downed freighter still full of inedible cargo.
Hydian Way
The Mandalorian blockade of the Hydian Way was the site of numerous naval battles whose legacy remains adrift along the hyperlanes. Send your companion to salvage the destroyed ships.
<<1>> discovered a Jedi warship embedded in the hulk of a Mandalorian carrier drifting far off the main space lane; the ships provide truly unique finds.
Liquidation Sale
A recent groundquake has sent one of the business districts on Mima Two on a slow slide into a magma pool. Send your companion to scour the district before the plunge.
When <<1>> arrived, the doomed section of the city had reached a lull in its slide, allowing for a thorough search of its businesses before the danger became too much.
Cratered
Folor was recently struck by a massive meteor; the resulting fissure stretches thousands of kilometers and is rich with meteoric mineral deposits. Send a companion to retrieve these resources.
<<1>> dislodged a great chunk of the massive asteroid from Folor's new geographic feature; it'll provide ample raw material for manufacturing.
Old Bones

Construction efforts have uncovered kilometers of mass graves from the Mandalorian Wars, stalling progress as historians and bureaucrats argue over how to proceed. Send a companion to exhume lost relics.
Aside from dead soldiers, the Mandalorians also unceremoniously dumped the privileged classes in ditch graves along with all their "useless" opulence.
The Myth Metal
You found a strange lump of metal. It appears to have come from the mythical mines of Bos-Una Three--have your companion trace it back.

<<1>> sought out everyone who came in contact with the lump of metal, and eventually--with the help of an old Duros spacer--determined that the lost mines of Bos-Una Three are real, treacherous and filled with prizes!
Hypori's Defects
Every day, the Hypori Droid Factory throws out thousands of defective droid parts. You've obtained the factory security codes--have your companion use them to comb Hypori's scrap heaps.
<<1>> posed as a Hypori associate, and successfully escorted several working--if slightly defective--droids right out of the factory.
Spoils of War
The battle for control of Sullust is over, but the fruits of that conquest are still ripe for the picking. Send your companion to reap the spoils.
<<1>> found a functional computer network in an abandoned manufacturing facility and was able to recover some unique schematics.
Personal Magnetism
After passing through a powerful ion storm, the vessel Phantom Lady has been rapidly accumulating space detritus. Send your companion to free the beleaguered transport from the junk.
Among the various trash coating the Phantom Lady was a mineral-rich asteroid filled with rare meteoric ores.
Cannok Hunt
Cannoks, beasts native to Dxun, are known for eating anything and everything--junk included. Send your companion on a cannok hunt to see what the beasts have eaten lately.
<<1>> hunted dozens of cannoks and managed to piece together most of an ancient weapon the beasts had eaten in Dxun's forests.
The Nebula of Steel
Old salvagers gossip about a nebula created by a huge fleet, mysteriously vaporized during the Hutt Cataclysms. Now someone has whispered the coordinates to you; have your companion check it out.
The coordinates didn't lead to a nebula, but <<1>> did find a vast debris field with valuable pickings. Perhaps this is the source of the nebula's myth?
Perils of Peragus
Since an explosion destroyed Peragus Two, the lawless Peragus system has been littered with debris from fuel mining stations. Have your companion search for anything valuable.
<<1>> discovered the destroyed remains of a mining station and managed to recover its computer, which contains several interesting logs and schematics.
Squealers Never Prosper
The Exchange has sent a message to a disloyal associate, by blowing up his valuable agricultural silos on Prishardia. Send your companion to recover whatever's left.
While picking through the remains of the destroyed agricultural silos, <<1>> discovered the Exchange's real target: a hidden arms cache!
Conspicuous Consumption

Plorbaas the Hutt is so rich that whenever his palace overflows with luxuries, he abandons them and moves into a new one, as a show of prestige. Have your companion search Plorbaas's old palaces for valuables.
While investigating one of Plorbaas's old palaces, mostly picked clean, <<1>> found a hidden chamber that held the Hutt's rare weapons collection.
Secrets of the Cron Drift
Created by the detonation of a Sith device, the Cron Drift is a huge expanse of asteroids and starship debris. If your companion can handle the local criminals, a fortune in salvage could be found.
<<1>> struck a deal with one of the Cron Drift's warlords for safe passage, and found an almost-intact Sith starship complete with several valuable items.
The Paaerduag Junkers
After being turned away by dozens of scrapyard worlds, a group of Paaerduag junk dealers are desperate to get rid of their haul. Your companion could get a good deal.
<<1>> feigned disinterest until the Paaerduags dropped their price, then traded for some scrap metal and a mysterious, malfunctioning weapon.
Where Droids Go to Die
Inside a damaged memory core, you found the location of GNR-0--the sacred "droid graveyard" where artificial beings go to die! Have your companion investigate.
<<1>> found GNR-0, the droid graveyard, built inside a heavy metal asteroid. No one will ever miss a few spare parts.
Keys to the Kingdom
You acquired the deed to a broken-down Hutt space station infested with rogue droids. Have your companion visit your treacherous new property.
<<1>> made it onto your new space station intact, and found it crawling with dangerous droids. After some time, <<1>> returned with some valuable salvage--but the space station won't function again.
Blood and Steel
The loss of the Arkanian Cybernetic Research Center during the last war accounted for a monumental loss of rare materials and data. Send a companion to reclaim anything left.
<<1>> discovered a compromised data safe within a collapsed section of a wall; despite all odds, the design specifications within were still intact.
Perfectionist
For decades, Darth Perash has been building an elaborate tomb, frequently ordering the builders to pull it down and start over. Have your companion sift through the latest rubble for anything useful.
<<1>> recovered several loads of construction materials from the unfinished tomb, including a few odd items Darth Perash had overlooked.
Short Sharp Shock
A mining station orbiting the gas giant Sirilla has been caught in an electrical storm, frying the entire droid crew. Have your companion brave the storm to find what survived.
<<1>> ventured into Sirilla's storm and salvaged the station's droids, as well as a hidden payload of mined hydrogen gas.
The Carbonite Mines
Miners on frozen Keres Two have abruptly deserted their outpost, leaving valuable carbonite deposits behind. Send your companion to claim them--though the miners' sudden departure is still a mystery.
<<1>> ventured deep into the Keres Two mines and encountered a vicious terentatek, once frozen in the ice! <<1>> just managed to escape--with a vast haul of carbonite and ores.
Fossil Records
The planet Noe'ha'on has vast fossil beds, littered not only with preserved remains but the tools of failed expeditions sent to recover them. Have your companion see if anything valuable is left.
<<1>> found an abandoned paleontologists' camp near the fossil beds, complete with working equipment and a carefully-cleaned fossil.
Fire and Ice
The frozen planet Jebble was razed by the Mandalorians centuries ago to stop a rakghoul outbreak at a base there. Send your companion to comb Jebble's wastes for anything worth saving.
After hunting near the remains of the Mandalorian base, <<1>> discovered the entrance to the Mandalorians' old ice mines! The mines are still intact, and so is their equipment.
A Field of Debris
Metellos's upper atmosphere has hundreds of floating cities, home to the Metellos elite. Their trash accumulates in Metellos's orbit; have your companion sift through the debris field.
One of Metellos's floating cities, damaged by a debris hit, had been condemned and evacuated. Bad for the inhabitants, but <<1>> returned with plenty of salvage.
Cleansing the Seas
As part of an environmental cleanup operation, Adikaria's oceans are being dredged and the detritus of centuries removed. Have your companion discover what's been lost in these seas.
Along with much rubbish and the remains of giant sea creatures, <<1>> discovered a wrecked submersible from the early days of Adikaria's exploration.
Killiks of Sarafur
The desert planet Sarafur has hundreds of empty Killik nests, abandoned millennia ago. Send your companion to see if anything has survived the centuries.
Sarafur's hot climate has preserved the ancient Killik nests. <<1>> found the belongings of long-lost Killik Joiners and some old, crystallized membrosia.
Bazaar Invitation
You found an invitation to the Rescued Property Appreciation Society, a secret underworld scavengers' bazaar. Send your companion to seek out any interesting finds.
A nervous "merchant" eager to offload his wares sold <<1>> a number of rare items for practically a steal.
Throwing Out Diamonds
Admiral Vel wishes to recover a prototype starship accidentally scrapped on Axxila's junk moons. He only wants the ship; anything else your companion discovers is yours to keep.
<<1>> found not only the starship, but several other prototypes that had been accidentally scrapped. Moff Vel is launching an investigation, but didn't forget to reward <<1>> first.
Shipping Out
The Hutts are moving several ammunition caches from Nfolgai to a secret location. Send your companion to Nfolgai to catch anything useful that falls through the cracks.
<<1>> was mistaken for a Moff's representative, and entrusted with an entire shipload of Nfolgai equipment. Most of it reached its destination--enough to avoid suspicion.
Dantooine's Forgotten Houses
The Sith bombed Dantooine during the Jedi Civil War, destroying several farming estates as well as a Jedi enclave. Have your companion search these ruins for any forgotten items.
<<1>> explored the overgrown ruins of the Sandral estate on Dantooine and found an old cache of emergency goods and equipment buried nearby.
It's For Their Own Good
Corrupt authorities on Castell are confiscating "items of concern" from local citizens and shipping them offworld. Have your companion sneak in and see what's there.

While investigating the confiscated goods, <<1>> was accidentally caught inside the shipment! Happily, that only meant more time to search through it and deprive the corrupt officers of their takings.
Calius saj Leeloo
Calius saj Leeloo--the City of Glowing Crystal, capital of Berchest--is one of the twenty wonders of the galaxy. Send your companion to harvest its treasures.
<<1>> found and excavated a large and extremely rare mineral formation from the base of the crystal city.
Hunting Party
Two Trandoshan clans have finished a hunting competition on Alaris Prime. They took trophies, but perhaps the bodies of the losing hunters are worth searching; send your companion.
<<1>> found the carcass of a massive beast the Trandoshans had claimed. Although its head and tail were gone, its hide was studded with the remains of old weapons.
Hypori's Defects
Every day, the Hypori droid factory throws out thousands of defective droid parts. Have your companion sneak into the factory to comb Hypori's scrap heaps.
<<1>> posed as a Hypori associate, and successfully escorted several working (if slightly defective) droids right out of the factory.
The Floating Hospital
The Selkath have decided to retire a floating medical facility on Adamastor's oceans, leaving it to the waves. Send your companion to claim anything the Selkath left behind.
<<1>> entered the medical facility and recovered several experimental medical devices the Selkath had abandoned.
The Remains of Aaris
A brutal civil war on Aaris Three destroyed much of the planet's civilization, leaving many cities abandoned. Have your companion search the ruins for lost valuables.
<<1>> discovered a well-preserved bunker stocked with old weapons and military supplies, returning with a healthy stock of serviceable equipment.
Ghost of the Past
The holorecord you recovered gives the coordinates of an ancient Rakata warship, floating lifeless in space. Send your companion to explore the mysterious derelict.
<<1>> bypassed the Rakata derelict's automated defense systems and found an untouched cache of materials and munitions.
Control Measures
An experiment on Toprawa has gone horribly awry, destroying an entire laboratory complex. Send your companion to recover anything that remains.
<<1>> braved the still-smoking Imperial laboratory and found several interesting items that had been used as part of the ill-fated experiment.
The Speaking Moon
An asteroid strike on one of Yavin's moons has uncovered the remains of an old communications outpost. Send your companion to search for anything useful.
<<1>> found the communications outpost's heavily-shielded bunker, which contained intact computer banks. <<1>> successfully downloaded the surviving data.
From the Vaults
A renowned museum is cleaning house, throwing out forgotten exhibits, broken artifacts, fakes and hoaxes. Send your companion to see if this trash contains any treasure.
<<1>> found a forgotten cache of broken armor amongst the museum's rubbish, some from the Mandalorian Wars. Even as scrap, it's still very valuable.
Caught in the Act
After an expenses scandal, a planetary governor is being forced to get rid of several luxury starships. Send your companion to claim everything of value before they're gone.
<<1>> cleaned out several of the luxury starships, including their advanced protocol droids, and gathered details on their construction.
The Hidden Merchants
A black market arms bazaar is being held somewhere among the moons of Aduba Five. Send your companion to examine the logs of nearby Skyrun Station for clues to the criminals' whereabouts.
After uncovering the location of the arms bazaar, <<1>> commandeered the criminals' systems.
Trail of Credits
Notorious Rodian crimelord Vano Baruk pays millions in bribes to officials on both sides of the war. Send your companion to slice his computers and find out who's on his payroll.
Slipping past Baruk's security, <<1>> retrieved all of his financial records, then used their access to bankrupt the crimelord permanently.
Secrets of the Past
An ancient navigational probe of unknown origin has been located in the Raxus system. Send your companion to slice the mysterious probe's datacore.
<<1>> sliced the probe's datacore and discovered it dated back to the Rakata empire. <<1>> recovered both survey data and several interesting technological schematics.
Secrets for Sale
Skoo Weebe, a Rodian information broker, is selling military secrets on the open market. Send your companion to slice his computers to reveal his sources.
<<1>> sliced Skoo Weebe's computers and found a list of military officers on his payroll. <<1>> also found critical information about enemy troop deployments.
An Open Contract
Czerka Corp is a recent victim of several slicer attacks. Corporate officials are offering a reward to any slicer who can help plug the security leaks.
<<1>> identified several flaws in Czerka's computer network security and tracked the most recent slicer attack back to the individuals responsible.
Extended Warranty
After many reports of malfunctioning implants and prosthetic limbs, Palauka Cybernetics has shut down production to investigate. Send your companion to help.
<<1>> helped Palauka Cybernetics' technicians track down a software fault, and wrote an entirely new software suite for them. Palauka has been very generous.
Vanishing Acts
Several criminal allies need new identities, fast. Clean backgrounds, new bank accounts... and no questions asked. Have your companion slice their records.
<<1>> pulled an all-nighter and gave the criminal agents watertight new identities. Several valuable items have mysteriously entered your possession as a result.
Opportunism
An enemy warship has docked at a neutral space station for repairs and refueling. Send your companion to infiltrate the station and sabotage the ship's systems.
<<1>> subtly altered the warship's systems, ensuring that its weapons and shields will fail the moment it enters pitched battle.
Seller's Market
A corrupt army officer on Talay is believed to be selling weapons on the black market. Send your companion to slice his records and track these illegal sales.
<<1>> easily recovered the officer's records, allowing military police to arrest him as well as dozens of his buyers.
Finders Keepers
The Exchange has seized an Imperial probe droid full of reconnaissance data. Send your companion to capture the droid's information and destroy it before the enemy does.
<<1>> easily retrieved the captured droid's memory data and replaced it with false readings to confuse the enemy.
Pirate Partygoers
A notorious pirate captain has been spotted carousing on Socorro. While he's distracted, send your companion to slice his ship's navicomputer and determine the pirates' home base.
<<1>> easily bypassed the captain's security and secured the data from his ship's navicomputer, then wiped it clean, ensuring the authorities will reach the pirates' base first.
Nobody's Friend
Hutt databases on Kor Nasirii contain information used to blackmail prominent figures throughout the galaxy. Send your companion to seize this information.
<<1>> skillfully evaded the Hutts' heavy security, capturing all of their blackmail materials and destroying the original copies so no blackmail can occur.
High Finance
A high-ranking corporate official suspects funds are being siphoned out of his various business accounts. Send your companion to confirm his theory and stop the theft.
<<1>> confirmed funds were being siphoned off. The corporate official threw in a bonus when <<1>> tracked the stolen credits to determine the identity of the thief.
Reclaim What's Ours
Crizlon, a Chevin information broker, sliced into several military databases. Send your companion to Vinsoth to recover the classified data before he sells it to the enemy.
<<1>> sliced Crizlon's computers and discovered the Chevin was stealing info from both the Empire and the Republic. <<1>> recovered all the data and wiped the datacores clean.
On the Take
Officials suspect a high-ranking military officer is working for the other side. Send your companion to slice her computers to find out if the rumors are true.
<<1>> sliced the officer's computers and discovered that she was being framed by one of her underlings. The real traitor was immediately arrested by security.
For Better or Worse
A noble of the Tion Hegemony suspects her husband is cheating on her. Send someone to slice into his personal holocom to look for evidence of infidelity.
<<1>> sliced the nobleman's account and discovered he was having multiple affairs. The wife paid <<1>> a bonus to clean out all her husband's financial accounts.
Fraternity of Thieves
You found an invitation from Torphus the Hutt setting up a meeting of "like-minded associates." Your companion could slice Torphus's guest list and obtain data on his criminal allies.
<<1>> sliced Torphus the Hutt's guest list and recovered dozens of names--including those of several notable politicians.
Creative Accounting
The droid memory core you recovered shows a Neimoidian businessman defrauding governments out of millions of credits. Have your companion slice his accounts to reclaim these funds.
<<1>> swiftly bypassed the Neimoidian's security and reallocated his stolen funds. The credits are in their proper place, and the Neimoidian is much poorer.
Slice the Slicer
An information broker on Groth has sliced into a military database. Send your companion to confiscate this criminal's client list and eradicate all stolen data.
<<1>> successfully lured the information broker into one of his own security traps, capturing him and his client list in a single stroke!
Sullustan Conspiracy
A planetary official on Sullust has defected and escaped to the enemy. Send your companion to slice his former associates' computers to see who may have helped him escape.
<<1>>'s investigation uncovered a highly organized ring of traitors, all of whom are now in Imperial custody.
Dirtying the Slate
The criminal database on Duro has been wiped clean by unknown slicers. Send your companion to help recover the lost data and determine who's responsible.
Once <<1>> successfully restored the criminal database, it was easy to identify the cadre of criminals responsible and lure them to their own arrests.
Identify and Neutralize
The infamous assassin known only as "Striker" has been tracked to the Aduba system. Send your companion to slice the local database for clues to Striker's true identity.
<<1>> easily uncovered Striker's true identity and used the Empire's systems to lure him into a trap laid by Republic authorities.
Working for Brolla
Brolla the Hutt wants someone to slice into a rival's computer system. Brolla hasn't said what he's looking for, but he's promised to pay well.
<<1>> sliced the computers of Brolla's rival, exposing Brolla's right-hand as a traitor. <<1>> also left behind a virus, prompting Brolla to throw in a nice bonus.
Take the Money and Run
The Finance Minister on the neutral world of Livien disappeared with millions of stolen credits. Send one of your companions to slice his computers and find out where he went.
<<1>> tracked the Finance Minister to the casino world of Ahakista, then froze his accounts. Authorities arrested him and recovered most of the stolen funds.
Droid Madness
Ubrikkien Industries has delayed shipment on its new line of medical droids due to malfunctioning programs. Send your companion to see if the droids can be fixed.
<<1>> discovered a slicer working for a rival firm was sabotaging the Ubrikkien med droids. <<1>> restored the original programming and tracked the slicer down.
Dead and Gone
A decade ago, Scraaz, a Rodian smuggler, double-crossed the Exchange. Tired of running, he wants someone to slice into official records to help him fake his death.
<<1>> sliced into official databanks and planted records detailing Scraaz's sudden death. <<1>> also forged electronic documents to give the Rodian a new identity.
Prince of Fools
Embarrassing holos of Prince Edruu of Doan are being anonymously transmitted across the HoloNet. The prince has offered a substantial reward if the culprit is identified.
<<1>> tracked the embarrassing holos to Edruu's own father, who wanted to teach his son humility. The king was so impressed with <<1>> he doubled Edruu's original offer.
Corporate Espionage
A slicer stole prototype designs for a new shuttle from Zentine Dynamics. He's hiding out on Verroth; send your companion to recover the data and destroy his files.
<<1>> sliced the slicer's computers, recovered the shuttle designs, destroyed the slicer's files and even pocketed some key items from a valuable cache of tech data.
Twist Their Arm
You found a military datapad sliced and vandalized by freelance slicers calling themselves "the Vortex." Send your companion to track the group and bring it down.
The Vortex slicers are good, but <<1>> is better. The group is devoted to anarchy throughout the galaxy and the co-opting of HoloNet channels; but after this mission, the members won't be a problem.
Aggressive Fundraising
A datapad reveals the identities of six financiers who have given funds to the enemy. Send your companion to hack their accounts on Muunilinst.
<<1>> sliced the accounts of the financiers and redirected the funds to your side, bankrupting the financiers.
The Automated Saboteur
An enemy surveillance droid is posing as a protocol unit on Ashas Ree. Send your companion to capture the droid and retrieve its data before it can wipe its own memory.
<<1>> retrieved the droid's memory data while it was offline at a charging station, ensuring that the Republic will never know their spy has been compromised.
Prototypical Chaos
A prototype war droid went on a rampage during a firing test and can't be stopped. Send your companion to slice the droid's systems and shut it down.
Using sophisticated logic loops, <<1>> overloaded the droid's neural processor, shutting it down without damage.
Arranged Accidents
A series of fatal collisions has all but halted production at the Kuat shipyards. Your companion should investigate whether their automated traffic controller has been sabotaged.
With <<1>>'s help, the Kuat shipyards repaired the sabotage to their traffic control programs and captured the enemy agents responsible.
Dereliction of Duty
Government patrol droids on Mindor have been wandering off course and ignoring their orders. Have your companion examine the droids and determine if sabotage is to blame.
<<1>> quickly removed the droids' bad programming and used the evidence to aid in the capture of the technician responsible.
Missing Probes
A Tashelin Industries probe crashed while exploring the Meligin Asteroid Belt. Send your companion to recover the probe's datacore and collect Tashelin's offered reward.
<<1>> located the probe and recovered the survey data. <<1>> also discovered the probe was sabotaged by a corporate rival. Tashelin officials offered a nice bonus for the info.
Spy Droid
Czerka Corp discovered one of their astromech droids was gathering classified corporate intel. Send your companion to slice the droid's datacore and expose the guilty party.
<<1>> sliced the droid's datacore and discovered it was working for one of Czerka's corporate rivals. <<1>> also found a list of Czerka employees who had been paid off.
Watching and Listening
An old communications satellite has been found near Centares. It's been monitoring galactic comm channels for centuries; have your companion slice its memory.
<<1>> sliced the comm satellite's memory and discovered it had overheard many secret enemy messages. This satellite could be useful in the future....
Blocked
Vital military comm traffic is being jammed from somewhere in the Si'Klaata Cluster. Send your companion to trace the jamming signal and shut it down.
<<1>> sliced the jamming signal and tracked it to a Hutt comm tower in the Khorya system. It looks like the signal was designed only to listen in, but malfunctioned.
Be Careful What You Read
An anonymous HoloNet message promises great rewards, if a single file is implanted in the Black Sun's private network. Your companion could arrange it.
<<1>> sliced into the Black Sun's network and planted the file, downloading plenty of interesting data as well. The mysterious client has sent a reward.
Pointing Fingers
Two pazaak tournament champions have accused each other of cheating in their last match. Have your companion slice the match records to check for fraud.
<<1>> sliced the pazaak match records. One of the players was cheating--and had cleverly implicated his opponent. <<1>> was given a reward for uncovering the deception.
We All Make a Living
Herra Ros, an engineer turned defector, is offering juicy enemy secrets in return for a year's salary. Send your companion to slice her network and check if she's trustworthy.
<<1>> discovered "Herra Ros" is a known alias of a famous con artist. Still, when confronted, she did offer valuable information in return for her freedom.
Flying Factory
You've recovered the early design of a prototype war droid the enemy is developing in a starship lab in the Outer Rim. Send your companion to slice the starship and disable it.
<<1>> not only disabled the starship lab that was building the prototype, but also recovered more advanced plans.
Incriminating Evidence

The datacore of an astromech droid reveals the cover-up of a murder of a pilot by a prominent Alderaanian noble. Send your companion to slice Alderaan's network and plant the evidence of the cover-up for all to see.
<<1>> planted evidence of the murder and cover-up, and the nobleman was immediately arrested.
Delivery Failure
A cargo ship carrying military-issue weapons has gone missing, and records of its departure from Korriz seem to have been altered. Send your companion to investigate.
<<1>> identified the pirates responsible for the ship's theft, then arranged a fake shipment to lure them into a navy ambush. All pirates were captured.
Sabotage and Repair
Enemy slicers have sabotaged a military space station's automated defenses. Send your companion to repair them before enemy warships attack.
<<1>> rapidly repaired the enemy slicers' sabotage, allowing the station's defenders to easily repel the Empire's attack force.
The Cleanest Profession
The trade world of Ulmatra houses hundreds of corporations that may be laundering credits. Have your companion slice their computers and see whose money is dirty.
<<1>> sliced the records of Ulmatra's businesses and discovered several that launder money for the Exchange. The Hutt Cartel paid handsomely for this information.
His Home is his Castle
An Alderaanian nobleman wants only the best cybersecurity for his new mansion, and he's offering big credits for good work. Have your companion take care of it.
After being given a generous expense account, <<1>> bought the best peripherals credits can buy and set up an impregnable security network for the noble.
Off the Grid
